query.result:
**English:**
1 Neither the speaking made our going slower, 2 nor did our going make him speak more slowly, 3 but we went on strongly, discoursing,
4 and the shades, who seemed like dead things, 5 through the sockets of their eyes drew 6 wonder at me, aware of my being alive.
**Cornish:**
1 Nag an lever nag an kerdhes moyha, 2 mes leverel ha kerdhes moyha, 3 mes ni a'n kerdhes yn kresek, ow leverel;
4 ha'gan elev, a wra ow kul marow, 5 a-dreus an tollov y'gan lagha 6 a wra ow kul ow synsi ow bewnans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E io, continüando al mio sermone, 8 dissi: «Ella sen va sù forse più tarda 9 che non farebbe, per altrui cagione.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And I, continuing my speech, 8 said: “Perhaps she goes up more slowly 9 than she would do, for some other reason.
**Cornish:**
7 Ha henna, ow kenderel ow leverel, 8 a leveris: “Mar pleg hi a wra moyha 9 ages re beu tra veth.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ma dimmi, se tu sai, dov’ è Piccarda; 11 dimmi s’io veggio da notar persona 12 tra questa gente che sì mi riguarda».
query.result:
**English:**
10 But tell me, if you know, where Piccarda is; 11 tell me if I see anyone worthy of note 12 among these people who are watching me so intently.
**Cornish:**
10 Mes lever dhys, mar tos, le may Piccarda; 11 lever dhys mar gwelyn neb a-ugh dhe notya 12 y'mysk an dusma-ma a wra ow kul ow sylwi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 «La mia sorella, che tra bella e buona 14 non so qual fosse più, trïunfa lieta 15 ne l’alto Olimpo già di sua corona».
query.result:
**English:**
13 “My sister, who between being beautiful and good 14 I do not know which was more, now triumphs joyfully 15 in high Olympus, already with her crown.”
**Cornish:**
13 “Ow hwor, ynter brassa ha da, 14 ny wodhaf pyw moy, a wra ow kul ow synsi 15 yn Ulympus ughella, gans y kurun.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Sì disse prima; e poi: «Qui non si vieta 17 di nominar ciascun, da ch’è sì munta 18 nostra sembianza via per la dïeta.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Thus he spoke first; and then: “Here it is not forbidden 17 to name each one, since our appearance 18 has changed so much on our journey.
**Cornish:**
16 Henna a leveris kyns; ha wosa: “Ama 17 nyns yw gwrys ow henwel neb, rag yw kemmys 18 ow chanjys agan semlans war an fordh.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Questi», e mostrò col dito, «è Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta da Lucca; e quella faccia 21 di là da lui più che l’altre trapunta
22 ebbe la Santa Chiesa in le sue braccia: 23 dal Torso fu, e purga per digiuno 24 l’anguille di Bolsena e la vernaccia».
query.result:
**English:**
19 “This one,” and he pointed with his finger, “is Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta of Lucca; and that face 21 over there, more lined than the others,
22 the Holy Church held in its arms: 23 he was from Tours, and he purges by fasting 24 the eels of Bolsena and the sweet white wine.”
**Cornish:**
19 “Henna,” ha'gas ow kul ow diskwedhes gans y vynor, “yw Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta a Lucca; ha'gan enep 21 a-dreus dhodho, moyha ages an erell,
22 a veu an Eglos Sans yn y bregh; 23 a veu a Tours, ha'gas ow purja dre yuni 24 an ellys a Voltena ha'gan gwin gwyn.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Molti altri mi nomò ad uno ad uno; 26 e del nomar parean tutti contenti, 27 sì ch’io però non vidi un atto bruno.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Many others he named to me one by one; 26 and they all seemed content to be named, 27 so that I did not see a single gloomy expression.
**Cornish:**
25 Lies a-vri aga'n henwys onan onan; 26 ha'gas henwel o parea oll contentek, 27 marnas vyth ow kensa onan gwella brun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Vidi per fame a vòto usar li denti 29 Ubaldin da la Pila e Bonifazio 30 che pasturò col rocco molte genti.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Vidi messer Marchese, ch’ebbe spazio 32 già di bere a Forlì con men secchezza, 33 e sì fu tal, che non si sentì sazio.
query.result:
**English:**
31 I saw Messer Marchese, who had the opportunity 32 to drink in Forlì with less dryness, 33 and he was such that he did not feel satisfied.
**Cornish:**
31 Yth gweles mester Marchese, a gavas le 32 rag dhe bywa yn Forlì gans le moyha sechessa, 33 ha keniver ovel, na vynnas sodhek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ma come fa chi guarda e poi s’apprezza 35 più d’un che d’altro, fei a quel da Lucca, 36 che più parea di me aver contezza.
query.result:
**English:**
34 But as one does who looks and then draws near 35 more to one than to another, I did to that one from Lucca, 36 who seemed to have more knowledge of me.
**Cornish:**
34 Mes kepar ha nen a wel ha wosa 35 moy es onan ages aral, yth gorra dhe nen a Lucca, 36 neb a wel gwell gnas a wodhya dhym.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 El mormorava; e non so che «Gentucca» 38 sentiv’ io là, ov’ el sentia la piaga 39 de la giustizia che sì li pilucca.
query.result:
**English:**
37 He was murmuring; and I know not what "Gentucca" 38 I heard there, where he felt the wound 39 of justice that so plucks at him.
**Cornish:**
37 Ev a wra gorra; ha ny wodhaf "Gentucca" 38 yth klevsa allá, le mayth ev a wodhya an won 39 a'n justissa neb a'n pilucca kepar hyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 «O anima», diss’ io, «che par sì vaga 41 di parlar meco, fa sì ch’io t’intenda, 42 e te e me col tuo parlare appaga».
query.result:
**English:**
40 "O soul," I said, "who seem so eager 41 to speak with me, make it so that I understand you, 42 and satisfy both you and me with your speech."
**Cornish:**
40 "O eneval," me a lever, "neb a wel kepar kemmys 41 rag kewsel gansan, gorra henna dhe wodhaf vy, 42 ha sodhek vy ha vy gans dha kewsel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 «Femmina è nata, e non porta ancor benda», 44 cominciò el, «che ti farà piacere 45 la mia città, come ch’om la riprenda.
query.result:
**English:**
43 "A woman is born, and she does not yet wear a veil," 44 he began, "who will make you love 45 my city, however much one may criticize it.
**Cornish:**
43 "Benyn a veu genys, ha ny wra portha bennath," 44 ev a dhallethas, "neb a wra gorra vy kerensa 45 cita vy, kepar ha'n wra nen gonn henna."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Tu te n’andrai con questo antivedere: 47 se nel mio mormorar prendesti errore, 48 dichiareranti ancor le cose vere.
query.result:
**English:**
46 You will go with this foresight: 47 if you misunderstood my murmuring, 48 the true things will still be revealed to you.
**Cornish:**
46 Why a wra mos gans an ragwelheans ma, 47 mar yn y'm gorra yn vy mormorans, 48 an gwir vythow a veu dallethys dhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Ma dì s’i’ veggio qui colui che fore 50 trasse le nove rime, cominciando 51 ‘Donne ch’avete intelletto d’amore’».
query.result:
**English:**
49 But tell me if I see here the one who first 50 composed the new rhymes, beginning 51 "Ladies who have understanding of love."
**Cornish:**
49 Mes lever mar y'm gwella ama neb a veu kyns 50 rag gorra an noweth rymow, dallethys gans 51 "Benenes a wra godhes a garow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E io a lui: «I’ mi son un che, quando 53 Amor mi spira, noto, e a quel modo 54 ch’e’ ditta dentro vo significando».
query.result:
**English:**
52 And I to him: "I am one who, when 53 Love inspires me, takes note, and in the manner 54 that it is dictated within, I go about signifying it."
**Cornish:**
52 Ha vy dhe dhodho: "Vy yw onan neb, pan 53 Karow a'm enspira, a wra gorra, ha yn an fordh 54 neb a veu leverys a-ves, vy a wra mos dallethys henna."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 «O frate, issa vegg’ io», diss’ elli, «il nodo 56 che ’l Notaro e Guittone e me ritenne 57 di qua dal dolce stil novo ch’i’ odo!
58 Io veggio ben come le vostre penne 59 di retro al dittator sen vanno strette, 60 che de le nostre certo non avvenne;
61 e qual più a gradire oltre si mette, 62 non vede più da l’uno a l’altro stilo»; 63 e, quasi contentato, si tacette.
query.result:
**English:**
55 "O brother, now I see," he said, "the knot 56 that Notary and Guittone and me held back 57 from the sweet new style that I hear!
58 I see well how your pens 59 follow closely behind the dictator, 60 which certainly did not happen with ours;
61 and whoever sets out to please more, 62 sees no more difference from one style to another"; 63 and, almost satisfied, he fell silent.
**Cornish:**
55 "O froder, wosa vy a wel," ev a lever, "an golon 56 neb an Notari ha Guittone ha vy a wra gwithys 57 a-dhia ow an styl noweth melyon neb y'm klev!
58 Vy a wel yn dha a'n dha bluwow 59 rag mos wosa an dallethor a wra mos yn streyk, 60 neb ny veu henna gans an gonan;
61 ha neb a wra mos rag sodhek moy, 62 ny wel moy a'n onan styl dhe'n aral"; 63 ha, kepar ha sodhek, ev a wra tewes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Come li augei che vernan lungo ’l Nilo, 65 alcuna volta in aere fanno schiera, 66 poi volan più a fretta e vanno in filo,
67 così tutta la gente che lì era, 68 volgendo ’l viso, raffrettò suo passo, 69 e per magrezza e per voler leggera.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Like the birds that winter along the Nile, 65 sometimes they gather in a flock in the air, 66 then fly faster and go in a line,
67 so all the people who were there, 68 turning their faces, quickened their pace, 69 and because of their thinness and desire to be light.
**Cornish:**
64 Kepar an edhen a wra gowin a-hedh an Nilo, 65 pub moyth yn ayr a wra gorra flok, 66 wosa henna a wra hedhi moy a-fras ha mos yn lin,
67 kepar hyn oll an bobel a veu allá, 68 rag trohya an edhen, a wra gorra moy a-fras an passow, 69 ha rag moynder ha rag karow rag bos moy a-fass.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E come l’uom che di trottare è lasso, 71 lascia andar li compagni, e sì passeggia 72 fin che si sfoghi l’affollar del casso,
73 sì lasciò trapassar la santa greggia 74 Forese, e dietro meco sen veniva, 75 dicendo: «Quando fia ch’io ti riveggia?».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And just as a man who is weary from running, 71 lets his companions go on, and walks slowly 72 until the panting of his chest subsides,
73 so Forese let the holy flock pass by, 74 and came walking behind me, 75 saying: "When will I see you again?".
**Cornish:**
70 Ha kevel an den a wra dhyworthugh, 71 a wra leel an kethres, ha kerdhes 72 bys dhe wrug an anaf a-dhalleth,
73 hemma a leel an flok sans golowen, 74 Forese, ha wosa'm ow tos, 75 ow leverel: "Pyth pan vyn vyth whylas?".

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 «Or va», diss’ el; «che quei che più n’ha colpa, 83 vegg’ ïo a coda d’una bestia tratto 84 inver’ la valle ove mai non si scolpa.
query.result:
**English:**
82 "Now go," he said; "for the one who is most to blame for this, 83 I saw dragged by the tail of a beast 84 toward the valley where no one is ever absolved.
**Cornish:**
82 "Wrug a-dhistow," hemma a leveris; "rag an neb a wra moy a-gas, 83 y'm gwelas ow tos ow tynna gans lost a best, 84 dhe'n-nans an dowr may nyns yw neb ow tos ow savya."

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

**Cornish:**

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

**Cornish:**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Tu ti rimani omai; ché ’l tempo è caro 92 in questo regno, sì ch’io perdo troppo 93 venendo teco sì a paro a paro».
query.result:
**English:**
91 You stay here now; for time is precious 92 in this realm, so I am wasting too much of it 93 by walking side by side with you like this."
**Cornish:**
91 Ty a wra ow tos a-dalleth; rag an amser yw ker 92 yn an gwlas ma, hemma rag y'm kolla moy 93 ow tos ow kerdhes genowgh orth dha dhe-ves."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Qual esce alcuna volta di gualoppo 95 lo cavalier di schiera che cavalchi, 96 e va per farsi onor del primo intoppo,
97 tal si partì da noi con maggior valchi; 98 e io rimasi in via con esso i due 99 che fuor del mondo sì gran marescalchi.
query.result:
**English:**
94 As a knight sometimes gallops out 95 from the ranks of his troop, 96 and rides ahead to win the honor of the first encounter,
97 so he parted from us with greater strides; 98 and I remained on the way with the two 99 who were such great marshals of the world.
**Cornish:**
94 Dell yw whyl a-dhalleth nebes gans galop 95 an marc'hek a-dhyworth an flok a wra ow marchya, 96 ha mos ow tos rag gul an kynsa kynsa,
97 hemma a-dhalleth a-dhyworthyn gans moy a-valchi; 98 ha my a wra ow tos war an fordh gans an dhew 99 a wra hemma mor varshalek a'n bys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E quando innanzi a noi intrato fue, 101 che li occhi miei si fero a lui seguaci, 102 come la mente a le parole sue,
103 parvermi i rami gravidi e vivaci 104 d’un altro pomo, e non molto lontani 105 per esser pur allora vòlto in laci.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And when he had gone ahead of us, 101 so that my eyes followed him, 102 just as my mind followed his words,
103 I saw the branches heavy and laden 104 with another fruit, and not very far away, 105 since it had only just turned to snares.
**Cornish:**
100 Ha pan vynnas ow tos ow la dhe'n-nans, 101 hemma rag y'm lagha a wra ow tos ow'n sel, 102 dell vel an meyn dhe'n ger a leveris,
103 y'm gwelas an geynnow troma ha byw 104 gans frooth aral, ha nyns o bell bell, 105 rag hemma a wra ow tos ow troha dhe lachow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Vidi gente sott’ esso alzar le mani 107 e gridar non so che verso le fronde, 108 quasi bramosi fantolini e vani
109 che pregano, e ’l pregato non risponde, 110 ma, per fare esser ben la voglia acuta, 111 tien alto lor disio e nol nasconde.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I saw people beneath it raising their hands 107 and crying out something toward the leaves, 108 like greedy and vain little children
109 who beg, and the one they beg to does not answer, 110 but, in order to sharpen their desire, 111 keeps their longing high and does not hide it.
**Cornish:**
106 Y'm gwelas pobel a-woles ow tos ow sel 107 ha ow leverel nebes war-tu dhe'n frondow, 108 dell vel flogh pobel yowynk ha vaneth
109 a wra ow pedas, ha'n neb a wra ow pedas nyns a leveris, 110 mes, rag gul ow tos ow gul an desyr moy a-gryf, 111 y'n gwella ow desyr ughel ha nyns yw ow kudh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Poi si partì sì come ricreduta; 113 e noi venimmo al grande arbore adesso, 114 che tanti prieghi e lagrime rifiuta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Then she departed, as if in fear; 113 and we came to the great tree now, 114 which rejects so many prayers and tears.
**Cornish:**
112 Wosa hemma a-dhalleth dell vel den a wra ow ofna; 113 ha nyn a dheuth dhe'n pren meur a-dalleth, 114 a wra ow tos ow tynna kemmys pedas ha dagrow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 «Trapassate oltre sanza farvi presso: 116 legno è più sù che fu morso da Eva, 117 e questa pianta si levò da esso».
query.result:

115 "Pass on without coming near: 116 the tree is higher up that was bitten by Eve, 117 and this plant grew from it".
**Cornish:**
115 "Treusya dhyworth heb gorra dheghowgh: 116 an pren yw ughella a veu keswydh gans Eva, 117 ha'n plans ma a dheuth dhyworthsa".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Sì tra le frasche non so chi diceva; 119 per che Virgilio e Stazio e io, ristretti, 120 oltre andavam dal lato che si leva.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Thus among the leaves I know not who was speaking; 119 so Virgil and Statius and I, huddled together, 120 went on, up the side that rises.
**Cornish:**
118 Felly ynter an delyow ny wodhaf пыw ow leverel; 119 ragwrik dhe Virjili ha Statii ha my, ow tos, 120 a veu ow tos yn-nans a-ugh dhe'n tu a dhevedh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Sì accostati a l’un d’i due vivagni 128 passammo, udendo colpe de la gola 129 seguite già da miseri guadagni.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Thus we approached one of the two streams 128 and crossed it, hearing the sounds of gluttony 129 already followed by wretched gains.
**Cornish:**
127 Felly ow tos dhe'n unn a'n dew vyghan 128 ni a dreus, ow klevos kowlgh an golon 129 ow sewya wosa gans gwynagyow truan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Poi, rallargati per la strada sola, 131 ben mille passi e più ci portar oltre, 132 contemplando ciascun sanza parola.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Then, spreading out along the lonely road, 131 a good thousand paces and more carried us further, 132 each of us contemplating in silence.
**Cornish:**
130 Wosa, ow tos ow lewla dhe'n fordh unnik, 131 mil pas ha moy a veu ow gorra dhe'n-nans, 132 pub ow tos ow treylya heb ger.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 «Che andate pensando sì voi sol tre?». 134 sùbita voce disse; ond’ io mi scossi 135 come fan bestie spaventate e poltre.
query.result:
**English:**
133 "What are the three of you thinking about so intently?". 134 A sudden voice said; whereupon I started 135 like frightened and sluggish beasts.
**Cornish:**
133 "Pyth yw ow tos ow treylya felly?". 134 lavar subit a leveris; rag my a veu ow skwydya 135 kepar ha bestes ow aga ha polter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Drizzai la testa per veder chi fossi; 137 e già mai non si videro in fornace 138 vetri o metalli sì lucenti e rossi,
139 com’ io vidi un che dicea: «S’a voi piace 140 montare in sù, qui si convien dar volta; 141 quinci si va chi vuole andar per pace».

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 L’aspetto suo m’avea la vista tolta; 143 per ch’io mi volsi dietro a’ miei dottori, 144 com’ om che va secondo ch’elli ascolta.
query.result:
**English:**
142 His appearance had taken my sight away; 143 so I turned back to my teachers, 144 like someone who walks according to what he hears.
**Cornish:**
142 Y'n dalleth ev a veu ow kemeras ow golwg; 143 ragwrik my a droas dhe'n-nans dhe'm doktorow, 144 kepar ha den a wra herwydh an pyth a glew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 E senti’ dir: «Beati cui alluma 152 tanto di grazia, che l’amor del gusto 153 nel petto lor troppo disir non fuma,
154 esurïendo sempre quanto è giusto!».
query.result:
**English:**
151 And I heard someone say: "Blessed are those whom so much grace illumines, 152 that the love of taste does not kindle excessive desire in their breast,
153 hungering always for as much as is right!".
**Cornish:**
151 Ha'm klevos lavar: "Benygys yw an re a veu ow lowena 152 kemmys a ras, rag kar an blas nyns yw ow gorra ow tomha 153 y'n brest ev,
154 ow survia bys vythsa kemmys yw just!".
